messages.content: On May 7th the country faces a very close General Election. Here in Gordon, the contest for your vote is between Liberal Democrat candidate, Christine Jardine, and Alex Salmond for the SNP.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: We have cut the deficit while protecting the recovery. The economy is growing.
We established the Grocery Code Adjudicator (GCA) to ensure fair terms for food producers.
Delivered on our promise of the Green Investment Bank, and it was Liberal Democrat ministers who ensured that it would be based in Scotland.

issues.brexitEurope: References to the EU Common Agricultural Policy (CAP) and new regulations affecting the rural economy of the North East under pressure from the Liberal Democrats.
issues.economy: We have cut the deficit while protecting the recovery. The economy is growing.
issues.governance: Stating that the SNP's idea of representation is not good enough.

contactInformation.address: Scottish Liberal Democrats, 8-10 Market Street, Ellon, AB41 9JD

endorsements.endorsement: Christine Jardine...a worthy successor, believes in a stronger economy and a fairer society.

quotes.text: Compare our record of standing up for rural communities with that of the SNP.

Instead we received less infrastructure funding than other parts of Scotland. Projects, such as the AWPR and the Tipperary to Balmedie dualling, were approved before the SNP came to power, and delayed by Salmond's Government.
The SNP's idea of representation is not good enough. We deserve better. We deserve a Liberal Democrat MP, Christine Jardine.

images.caption: Sir Malcolm Bruce and Christine Jardine in a rural setting.

leaflet.additionalNotes: P.S. We need a real show of strength at the start of the short campaign, which is less than a week away, to make a real impact. Can you show your support for Christine by letting us put up a poster on your property?
